question: 吐く
sourceAnswer:
<read>つく</read>:: to{} breathe-out/breathe | tell-(a-lie)/use-(foul-language) | vomit/throw-up/spit-up
<read>はく</read>:: to{} vomit/throw-up/spit-up | emit/send-forth/breathe-out | give-(an-opinion)/make-(a-comment)/express/tell | confess
userAnswer: to: vomit | breathe-out | tell | confess | <tag><ja>つく</ja>:</tag>lie | use-foul-language
activeAnswer: to: vomit | breathe-out | tell | confess | <tag><ja>つく</ja>:</tag>lie | use-foul-language
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>throw up</kanji> so the verb version is <vocabulary>to throw up</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to puke</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to spit</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is from the reading you learned with the kanji. HA HA HA! Barf.
